thread.title: The top things to do in Baltimore this week: Dru Hill, sci-fi and Dick Gregory
thread.title_full: The top things to do in Baltimore this week: Dru Hill, sci-fi and Dick Gregory

title: The top things to do in Baltimore this week: Dru Hill, sci-fi and Dick Gregory
text:
The top things to do in Baltimore this week: Dru Hill, sci-fi and Dick Gregory Frozen Harbor Music Festival Josh Sisk / Josh Sisk/Special To The Baltimo 
Dru Hill, with Sisqo, will be marking its 20th anniversary at this week's Frozen Harbor Music Festival. 
Dru Hill, with Sisqo, will be marking its 20th anniversary at this week's Frozen Harbor Music Festival. (Josh Sisk / Josh Sisk/Special To The Baltimo) Dru Hill, Katt Williams and Riverdance: These are the top things to do in Baltimore this week. 
Frozen Harbor Music Festival 
A slate of the hottest music around anywhere, just the thing for a (potentially) cold wintry weekend. Performers (more than 140 in all!) include Onyx, the Pietasters, Joe Pug and a group of guys who go by the name of Dru Hill. (Hey, any chance to hear them play live has got to be worth checking out, right?) Venues include Rams Head Live , 20 Market Place (where Dru Hill is playing at 10:30 p.m. Saturday), and Baltimore Soundstage, 124 Market Place, plus other Power Plant Live locations. The festival-going starts at 5 p.m. Friday and 3:30 p.m. Saturday. $15-$80. frozenharbor.com. 
Vegan Mac 'N Cheese Smackdown 
Local chefs do things with dairy-free mac 'n cheese you may never have thought possible. Oh, so delicious! 3 p.m.-7 p.m. Saturday at Baltimore City Community College, 2901 Liberty Heights Ave. $10-$15. pepfoodsinc.com. Best Picture Showcase Dale Robinette / Lionsgate 
"La La Land," with Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone, is one of nine movies nominated for this year's Best Picture Oscar. 
"La La Land," with Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone, is one of nine movies nominated for this year's Best Picture Oscar. (Dale Robinette / Lionsgate) 
Best Picture Showcase 
Perfect for those looking to get a leg up in their Oscar pool, or who simply want to see what the cinematic fuss is all about. Over the next two Saturdays, the AMC Columbia 14, 10300 Little Patuxent Parkway, will be showing all nine films up for this year's Best Picture Oscar. The moviegoing marathon begins at 10 a.m. Saturday with screenings of "Manchester by the Sea,""Fences,""Hell or High Water" and "La La Land." The showcase picks up again at 10 a.m. Feb. 25 with showings of "Moonlight,""Lion,""Hacksaw Ridge,""Arrival" and "Hidden Figures." Tickets are $32.50-$37.50 per day (sorry, tickets for individual films are not for sale). amctheatres.com. 
'Riverdance: The 20th Anniversary World Tour' 
Celebrating two decades of Irish dance, as well as the show's first time back in the states in four years. 8 p.m. Friday and Saturday, 2 p.m. Saturday, 1 p.m. next Sunday at the Modell Performing Arts Center at the Lyric, 140 W. Mount Royal Ave. $35-$80. lyricbaltimore.com. 
Farpoint 24 
For the 24th time, area sci-fi fans will gather to hobnob, discuss, view and otherwise celebrate the genre. This year's guest list includes writer-director Nicholas Meyer ("Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan") and TV actors Sam Witwer ("Once Upon a Time") and Enver Gjokaj ("Agent Carter"). Friday-next Sunday at the Radisson Hotel North Baltimore, 2004 Greenspring Drive in Timonium. $15-$85. farpointcon.com. Katt Williams Paras Griffin / Getty Images for The Vanity Grou 
Katt Williams will take to the stage at Royal Farms Arena on Tuesday. 
Katt Williams will take to the stage at Royal Farms Arena on Tuesday. (Paras Griffin / Getty Images for The Vanity Grou) 
Katt Williams 
Funny guy. At times a bit confrontational, too. Should be fun to hear what he's up to. 7 p.m. Tuesday at Royal Farms Arena , 201 W. Baltimore St. $55-$128. royalfarmsarena.com. 
Thirteenth Amendment Tour 
A four-hour exploration of the question, "Has slavery ever ended in America?" Starts at the Great Blacks in Wax Museum, 1601-03 E. North Ave., then proceeds via motorcoach to the Douglass-Myers Maritime Park in Fells Point before ending with a screening of Ava DuVernay's provocative documentary, "13th." Sounds like the sort of thing Black History Month was created for. 10 a.m. Monday. $35. greatblacksinwax.org. Dick Gregory 
Comedian/civil rights activist Dick Gregory will be at the Baltimore Comedy Factory today. 
Comedian/civil rights activist Dick Gregory will be at the Baltimore Comedy Factory today. (Brent N. Clarke / FilmMagic) 
Dick Gregory 
Has there even been a better time to hear the scathingly insightful political comedy of Dick Gregory? The man's earned the right to make us think hard while making us laugh. 5:30 p.m. today at the Baltimore Comedy Factory, 5625 O'Donnell St. $25. baltimorecomedy.com. 
'Rhythm and Romance' 
Looking for some last-minute Valentine's night ideas? How about an evening of American music standards, delivered with vocals and piano by Steve Ross , once called "the Crown Prince of New York Cabaret" by The New York Times. 6 p.m. Tuesday at the Cabaret at Germano's, 300 S. High St. $20. germanospiattini.com. Shen Yun Handout photo 
Chinese history and culture will be spotlighted when Shen Yun comes to the Hippodrome this week. 
Chinese history and culture will be spotlighted when Shen Yun comes to the Hippodrome this week. (Handout photo) 
Shen Yun 
Centuries of dynamic Chinese history and culture come to Baltimore for the weekend. 7:30 p.m. Friday and Saturday, 2 p.m. Saturday and next Sunday at the France-Merrick Performing Arts Center at the Hippodrome , 12 N. Eutaw St. $91.50-$230. france-merrickpac.com.ïƒ–.
